  physical_appearance: This artwork depicts a steamer being damaged by fire in stormy weather in the ocean. There is a wooden frame and it has a white border with a brown perimeter in between. At the bottom of the artwork
 its title is displayed in capital letters. Under its title
 there are three rows of paragraphs that dedicate this artwork to H.E. Vice Admiral Sir William Parker. The colours on the aquatint do not look smudged.  A paddle-wheel steamer is set ablaze in the middle of a tumultuous ocean. Several boats can be seen riding the waves around the steamer.

  sgcool_label_text: This print depicts the loss by fire of the Madagascar
 a paddle-wheel steamer
 with severa otherl boats seen in the midst of the storm. The steamer was caught in a typhoon at the entrance of the Formosa Channel when it was part of the British expedition to China in 1841. This aquatint was engraved by Edward Duncan
 after a painting by marine artist William Huggins
 who based his work on a sketch by the ship\u0027s captain James Minns Dicey. This print depicts the loss by fire of the Madagascar
 a paddle-wheel steamer
 with several other boats seen in the midst of the storm. The steamer was caught in a typhoon at the entrance of the Formosa Channel when it was part of the British expedition to China in 1841. This aquatint was engraved by Edward Duncan
 after a painting by marine artist William Huggins
 who based his work on a sketch by the ship\u0027s captain James Minns Dicey.

metadata.physical_appearance: This artwork depicts a steamer being damaged by fire in stormy weather in the ocean. There is a wooden frame and it has a white border with a brown perimeter in between. At the bottom of the artwork, its title is displayed in capital letters. Under its title, there are three rows of paragraphs that dedicate this artwork to H.E. Vice Admiral Sir William Parker. The colours on the aquatint do not look smudged.  A paddle-wheel steamer is set ablaze in the middle of a tumultuous ocean. Several boats can be seen riding the waves around the steamer.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This print depicts the loss by fire of the Madagascar, a paddle-wheel steamer, with severa otherl boats seen in the midst of the storm. The steamer was caught in a typhoon at the entrance of the Formosa Channel when it was part of the British expedition to China in 1841. This aquatint was engraved by Edward Duncan, after a painting by marine artist William Huggins, who based his work on a sketch by the ship's captain James Minns Dicey. This print depicts the loss by fire of the Madagascar, a paddle-wheel steamer, with several other boats seen in the midst of the storm. The steamer was caught in a typhoon at the entrance of the Formosa Channel when it was part of the British expedition to China in 1841. This aquatint was engraved by Edward Duncan, after a painting by marine artist William Huggins, who based his work on a sketch by the ship's captain James Minns Dicey.
